result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody W Gillis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $150 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment. Obtain GED/HSED.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Perform 50 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that he will be be representing Defendant on this case, will not be representing him on new file due to new employment. State advises that expungement offered as part of original offer is off the table based on new charges. Defense advises that Defendant wants to proceed. Court questions Defendant, who wants to accept offer with change. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that discovery has been received, has meeting next week, requests status conference.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Status conference set for May 11, 2015 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Bond set. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
